pageContext.claim: “It will make our blue-collar boom -- which is beyond anybody's expectation -- even bigger, stronger, and more extraordinary, delivering massive gains for the loyal citizens of our nation.”
pageContext.analysis: Even before the coronavirus pandemic, things had gotten grimmer for many blue-collar workers. The manufacturing sector was in a technical recession, and only 9,000 manufacturing jobs had been gained between June 2019 and February 2020, compared with the 460,000 in the first 2½ years of Trump’s presidency. Job growth slowed in many “blue-collar” sectors such as transportation, construction and mining.
